comments:
For some strange reason whenever I start Eclipse I get an error.
The error begins like this:
----------------
!SESSION Dec 08, 2004 22:01:25.767 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M200409161125
java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Dec 08, 2004 22:01:25.767
!MESSAGE Startup error
!STACK 1
java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: equals
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.SimpleHashtable.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(Unknown Source)
----------------

It happens with both Eclipse 3.0 and 3.0.1.  I think that one of the latest MS 
security patches may have broken it, because this worked a couple days ago and 
a "company required" security patch was installed and now it doesn't work.
This may be a stretch but my point is that Eclipse 3.0 used to work on my
machine.

My gut feeling is that this is NOT an eclipse bug/problem but a problem in the 
environment, but I tried running a custom written java program it runs ok.
I'm using JDK 1.4.2_04 on Win2000.

I googled for the error and didn't find anything relavent, and searched Eclipse 
bugs and didn't find any match on "java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: equals".
I'll keep looking but I'm hoping someone can give me some pointers.
Going back to Emacs hurts now that I'm hooked on eclipse. :-)

Keep up the good work.
Thanks,
Patrick

Well I got Eclipse to work again.  How?  By reloading Java.  I first
loaded JDK 1.5 and ran Eclipse and it worked.  I then tried Eclipse
3.0 with JDK 1.4.2_04 to see if the problem really went away.  It did
go away.  Eclipse 3.0 now starts up with either version of Java.  I'll
stick with JDK 1.5 since I've been meaning to upgrade.

So what caused the problem I was having?  I'm not (yet) sure.  I hope
this is either a fluke, or that my entry helps the next person out!

I'm mentioning this only in the off chance that it was a combination of 
installing JDK 1.5 AND renaming the workbench.xml file that "fixed the problem".

When looking through my notes.  I realized I also renamed 
<yourWorkspace>/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.ui.workbench/workbench.xml
to workbench-old.xml but this still didn't fix the problem.  Eclipse would 
still not start after this change.

I tried this BEFORE I downloaded JDK 1.5.

Created an attachment (id=16484)
Eclipse error log file that includes full stack trace

This file is the original error log file (with the full stack trace)
of the problem.  The filename was 
c:\P\eclipse3.0\configuration\1102559813930.log
but I don't think that name matters to anyone.
Wrong resolution (should only be marked fixed if changes were made to fix it)
Do you want me to do anything more with this bug report?
